com.stripe.stripeterminal

Class TerminalException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.stripe.stripeterminal.TerminalException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class TerminalException
extends java.lang.Exception
    A TerminalException represents an error thrown during SDK operations and will contain a TerminalException.TerminalErrorCode and an errorMessage to provide more specific details.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TerminalException.TerminalErrorCode
      A TerminalErrorCode represents the class of error

      ApiError getApiError()
      If the exception is of type API_ERROR, this field will return a representation of the error object, with additional details.

      PaymentIntent getPaymentIntent()
      If the exception is of type CONFIRM_PAYMENT_INTENT_ERROR, this will return one of three things: 1.

    • Method Detail

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
        Returns:
        the error message associated with this exception.

      • getErrorCode

        public TerminalException.TerminalErrorCode getErrorCode()
        Returns:
        the error code associated with this exception.

      • getPaymentIntent

        public PaymentIntent getPaymentIntent()
        If the exception is of type CONFIRM_PAYMENT_INTENT_ERROR, this will return one of three things: 1. The existing PaymentIntent with status REQUIRES_PAYMENT_METHOD. This signifies that there was a failure to confirm this payment method, and Terminal.collectPaymentMethod(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.ReaderDisplayListener, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) should be called again to try a new payment method. 2. The existing PaymentIntent with status REQUIRES_CONFIRMATION. This signifies that the request failed due to an unexpected error (e.g. a temporary connectivity problem) and the call to Terminal.processPayment(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) should be retried with the PaymentIntent returned. 3. Null. This signifies that the request to Stripe's servers timed out and the PaymentIntent's status is unknown. In this situation, the the call to Terminal.processPayment(com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntent, com.stripe.stripeterminal.PaymentIntentCallback) should be retried with the original PaymentIntent. For any other TerminalException.TerminalErrorCode, this will return null. https://stripe.com/docs/terminal/payments#process
        Returns:
        The current PaymentIntent

      • getApiError

        public ApiError getApiError()
        If the exception is of type API_ERROR, this field will return a representation of the error object, with additional details.
